files.name: spaceone/api/identity/v2/user.proto
files.description:
User API which allows member management within project, company, and domain
note: Administrator must register User first.

fields.name: password
fields.description:
When auth_type is LOCAL, password is required.
+optional

fields.name: reset_password
fields.description: If reset_password is true, send email

fields.name: force
fields.description:
If this value true, disable MFA without verification for user.
+optional

fields.name: options
fields.description: If mfa_type is EMAIL, email is required in options. options will be saved in mfa's options field.

methods.name: create
methods.description:
You can create user. after create user you have to binding role to user.
See role-binding create api.
External type user do not need password.

methods.name: update
methods.description: Update user info by given user_id

methods.name: enable_mfa
methods.description: Enable MFA for user. If this api is called, send email to user.

methods.name: disable_mfa
methods.description: Disable MFA for user. If this api is called, send email to user.

methods.name: confirm_mfa
methods.description: Confirm MFA for user by given verify_code which is sent by your authentication method.

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
